titles.title: A bill for the relief of Joyce G. McFarland.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House by House Committee on The Judiciary. Report No: 100-148.
Called up by House on Call of Private Calendar.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.
Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice. Approved for full committee consideration without amendment favorably.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1100.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/25/1987--Introduced. Deems a named individual to have elected, on a specified date, to waive entitlement to his military retired pay and to receive in lieu thereof a civil service retirement annuity based on his combined military and civil service. Directs that payment of a survivor annuity based on such individual's civil service retirement annuity commence with the first month beginning after enactment of this Act.
